definitions: incompatible or contradictory with each other causing discord or confusion
being in disagreement or opposition with another idea, statement, or position
examples: The witness gave conflicting accounts of the accident
These conflicting priorities make it hard to decide
Their conflicting schedules meant they rarely met
The team received conflicting instructions from management

definitions: flowing together or meeting at a point to form one stream
coming together at a junction point where separate paths merge
examples: The confluent rivers created a powerful waterway
Several confluent streams fed into the lake
The confluent roads met at the city center
These confluent ideas formed a new theory

definitions: complying with rules, standards, or laws that are established
acting in accordance with prevailing standards or customs
examples: The conforming products passed all quality tests
She wore conforming attire to the formal event
His conforming behavior pleased the school administrators
The conforming design met all building codes

definitions: following established behavior patterns and social conventions without questioning
examples: His conformist attitude helped him fit in quickly
The conformist students rarely challenged the rules
She rejected her conformist upbringing later in life
The company preferred conformist employees who followed protocol

definitions: perplexed and confused to the point of being unable to think clearly
used as a mild oath to express annoyance or frustration
examples: The confounded puzzle left everyone scratching their heads
She looked confounded by the complex instructions
That confounded machine never works properly
Get that confounded dog out of my garden

definitions: causing surprise or confusion by acting against expectations
mixing variables in a way that makes results difficult to interpret
examples: The confounding results challenged their hypothesis
Her confounding behavior left everyone puzzled
The confounding factors made the study unreliable
These confounding variables need to be controlled

definitions: tending to deal with situations in an aggressive or hostile manner
examples: His confrontational style made negotiations difficult
She avoided confrontational discussions at family dinners
The confrontational approach rarely solves workplace conflicts
Their confrontational attitude created unnecessary tension

definitions: unable to think clearly or understand what is happening
showing bewilderment and lack of clear understanding
examples: The confused student asked for help
He gave a confused explanation of events
The confused directions led them astray
She felt confused by all the options

definitions: difficult to understand and causing uncertainty or puzzlement
examples: The confusing instructions needed to be rewritten
This confusing map has too many symbols
Her confusing message left everyone wondering
The confusing layout made navigation difficult

definitions: pleasant because of having qualities or interests similar to one's own
agreeable and suitable to one's nature, tastes, or outlook
examples: The congenial atmosphere made everyone feel welcome
She found congenial companions at the book club
The congenial climate suited his health perfectly
They worked in congenial surroundings

definitions: existing from birth as a result of heredity or prenatal development
examples: The doctor diagnosed a congenital heart defect
Her congenital condition required lifelong treatment
The puppy had a congenital hip problem
Some congenital disorders can be treated early

definitions: blocked or filled with traffic or too many people
blocked with mucus making breathing difficult
examples: The congested highway caused major delays
The congested shopping mall was uncomfortable
His congested sinuses made sleeping difficult
The congested lungs required medical attention

definitions: formed of heterogeneous elements gathered into a mass
examples: The conglomerate rock contained many minerals
A conglomerate structure emerged from the merger
The conglomerate mass included various materials
This conglomerate organization spans many industries

definitions: expressing praise and good wishes for an achievement or good fortune
examples: She received many congratulatory messages after graduation
The congratulatory speech praised their hard work
His congratulatory tone showed genuine happiness
They sent congratulatory cards to the newlyweds

definitions: relating to a congregation or its style of worship and governance
examples: The congregational meeting discussed church finances
They preferred congregational singing during services
The congregational vote decided the new pastor
This congregational system gives members more control

definitions: in agreement or harmony with something else
identical in form when superimposed in geometry
examples: Their actions were congruent with their stated values
The results were congruent with our predictions
These congruent triangles have equal sides
The congruent shapes fit perfectly together

definitions: having the shape of a cone or relating to cones
examples: The conic structure tapered to a point
They studied conic sections in geometry class
The conic design improved aerodynamics
This conic projection preserves certain map properties

definitions: having a circular base and tapering to a point like a cone
examples: The conical hat was part of the wizard costume
The conical roof shed rain efficiently
Trees often have conical shapes in snowy regions
The conical flask is common in laboratories

definitions: bearing cones and evergreen leaves like pine or fir trees
examples: The coniferous forest stayed green all winter
Coniferous trees dominated the mountain landscape
They planted coniferous species for year-round privacy
The coniferous wood was ideal for construction

definitions: based on conjecture rather than complete information or evidence
examples: His conjectural theory lacked supporting evidence
The conjectural interpretation sparked debate among scholars
Their conjectural conclusions needed more research
This conjectural history fills gaps with assumptions

definitions: joined together physically or united as one entity
examples: The conjoined twins shared vital organs
These conjoined buildings form one complex
The conjoined efforts produced excellent results
Their conjoined properties created a larger estate

definitions: combined or associated together in a joint relationship
examples: Their conjoint efforts solved the problem quickly
The conjoint analysis revealed consumer preferences
The conjoint therapy showed better results
These conjoint factors influenced the outcome

definitions: relating to marriage or the relationship between married partners
examples: They enjoyed conjugal happiness for many years
The conjugal visit policy allowed family time
Their conjugal rights were protected by law
The conjugal relationship required mutual respect

definitions: joined together especially in pairs or in conjugate relationship
showing different forms according to voice, mood, tense in grammar
examples: The conjugated molecules formed a stable compound
These conjugated systems share electrons
She conjugated French verbs for practice
The conjugated forms followed regular patterns

definitions: joined or linked together physically or by relationship
having social, professional, or family relationships with influential people
examples: The connected rooms shared a bathroom
All devices stayed connected to the network
She was well connected in the business world
His connected family opened many doors

definitions: serving to connect or capable of connecting parts together
examples: The connective tissue held the muscles together
These connective words link ideas in writing
The connective element joined the two sections
Proper connective devices improve text flow

definitions: secretly plotting or scheming to do something immoral or illegal
examples: The conniving employee stole company secrets
Her conniving plan eventually backfired
They discovered his conniving attempts at fraud
The conniving characters made the movie exciting

definitions: wishing to do what is right and working carefully and thoroughly
examples: The conscientious student never missed an assignment
Her conscientious approach earned everyone's respect
He was conscientious about following safety rules
The conscientious worker double-checked every detail

definitions: dedicated formally to a religious or divine purpose
examples: The consecrate ground held special significance
They built on consecrate land near the church
The consecrate vessel was used for communion
This consecrate space allowed quiet reflection

definitions: made or declared sacred through religious ceremony or dedication
examples: The consecrated altar served for worship services
They buried him in consecrated ground
The consecrated oil was used for blessings
This consecrated building housed religious artifacts

definitions: done with the full agreement and permission of all people involved
examples: Their consensual arrangement worked well for both
The consensual decision satisfied all parties
They entered a consensual business partnership
All changes required consensual approval

definitions: giving permission or agreeing to something happening
examples: The consenting adults signed the contract
Both consenting parties agreed to the terms
The consenting participants joined the study
Only consenting individuals could take part

definitions: following as a result or effect of something
examples: The consequent damage required expensive repairs
His consequent actions showed poor judgment
The consequent delays affected the schedule
Their consequent meeting resolved the issues

definitions: important and having significant effects or results
examples: The consequential decision changed company direction
This consequential law affected millions of people
Her consequential research earned international recognition
The consequential error cost them the contract

definitions: protected from harm, decay, loss, or waste and maintained carefully
examples: The conserved building retained its historic character
These conserved resources lasted through winter
The conserved energy reduced monthly bills
Their conserved funds provided security

definitions: careful not to cause inconvenience or hurt to others
examples: Her considerate nature made her popular
The considerate neighbor kept noise levels low
He made considerate choices to help everyone
Their considerate behavior impressed the hosts

definitions: thought about carefully over time before being made or formed
examples: His considered opinion carried significant weight
She gave a considered response after reflection
The considered judgment came after much deliberation
Their considered approach avoided hasty mistakes

definitions: combined into a single more effective or coherent whole
examples: The consolidated report included all departments
Their consolidated efforts achieved better results
The consolidated company became more efficient
This consolidated approach streamlined operations

definitions: in agreement or harmony with something
having a pleasing combination of musical sounds
examples: His actions were consonant with his beliefs
The decision was consonant with company policy
The consonant tones created beautiful music
These consonant sounds blended well together

definitions: clearly visible or attracting notice through being unusual or remarkable
examples: Her conspicuous absence worried her friends
The conspicuous sign caught everyone's attention
His conspicuous wealth made him a target
The conspicuous error embarrassed the editor

definitions: relating to or suggesting a secret plan by a group
examples: She gave him a conspiratorial wink
Their conspiratorial whispers aroused suspicion
The conspiratorial meeting happened after midnight
His conspiratorial tone implied hidden knowledge

definitions: being a part of a whole or component of something
examples: The constituent parts needed careful assembly
Each constituent element served a purpose
The constituent ingredients were listed clearly
These constituent members formed the committee

definitions: established, set up, or formed according to laws or principles
examples: The properly constituted board made decisions
A constituted authority enforced the rules
The constituted government followed legal procedures
Their constituted committee met monthly

definitions: forming an essential element of something or helping to make up
examples: These constitutive elements defined the compound
The constitutive rules shaped the game
Her constitutive role was vital to success
The constitutive features remained unchanged

definitions: severely restricted or limited in freedom, action, or expression
examples: He felt constrained by strict regulations
Their constrained budget limited their options
She gave a constrained smile at the joke
The constrained space made movement difficult

definitions: severely limiting freedom of action or expression
examples: The constraining rules frustrated creative students
These constraining factors limited growth
The constraining environment stifled innovation
Her constraining schedule left no free time

definitions: made narrower or tighter especially by binding or squeezing
examples: The constricted blood vessels reduced circulation
His constricted throat made speaking difficult
The constricted passage slowed traffic flow
Her constricted breathing worried the doctor

definitions: serving a useful purpose and helping to improve a situation
examples: She offered constructive criticism to help improve
Their constructive approach solved problems effectively
The constructive feedback motivated the team
His constructive suggestions were always welcome

definitions: relating to the office or work of a consul
examples: The consular office helped stranded travelers
He sought consular assistance abroad
The consular staff processed visa applications
Their consular duties included citizen services

definitions: seeking or providing expert advice or consultation before deciding
examples: The consultative process included all stakeholders
Her consultative approach built team consensus
The consultative committee advised on policy
This consultative method improved decision making
